greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k): number of ways of partitioning the n-element multiset {1,1,2,3,...,n-1} into exactly k nonempty parts, n>=1 and 1<=k<=n.
formula: T(n,k) = S(n-1,k) + S(n-1,k-1) + C(k,2)*S(n-2,k), where S refers to Stirling numbers of the second kind (A008277), and C to binomial coefficients (A007318).
example: There are 58 ways to partition {1,1,2,3,4,5} into three nonempty parts.
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = stirling(n-1,k,2) + stirling(n-1,k-1,2) + binomial(k,2)*stirling(n-2,k,2); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 24 2014
xref: The first five columns appear as A000012, A083329, A168583, A168584, A168585.
results.author: _Andrew Woods_, Apr 24 2014
